Module com.example.dmscoursework
Package com.example.dmscoursework.Controller

Class AiController

java.lang.Object
com.example.dmscoursework.Controller.AiController
public class AiController extends Object
The AiController is the logic behind the AI. The AIController will move the paddle according to the position of the ball. It will check the time between bricks hit, if a brick has not been hit in a certain amount of time then the assumption is made that the ball is moving to same location and the ball needs to be reset so that the AI can start again. The AI has been able to complete all levels with the three specified lives.
Since:
04-01-2022
Version:
1.0
Author:
William Michiel Simson van Dijkhuizen

    void
    MovePaddle()
    Moves the paddle if a brick been hit recently, but if not AI will not move the ball as it means the ball is bouncing in the same location, and it needs to let ball drop to allow reset.

    • AiController

      public AiController(GameController gameController, LevelManager levelManager, CollisionChecker collisionChecker)
      Constructs an Ai which controls the movement of the paddle by using information from the game controller, level manager and the collision checker.
      Parameters:
      gameController - a GameController, which controls the game.
      levelManager - a levelManager, which manages the level.
      collisionChecker - a CollisionChecker, which checks for collisions.

  • Method Details

    • MovePaddle

      public void MovePaddle()
      Moves the paddle if a brick been hit recently, but if not AI will not move the ball as it means the ball is bouncing in the same location, and it needs to let ball drop to allow reset. If the AI is activated and the player comes back, the AI will let the player play only in this period where a brick hasn't been hit.
